issue.title: twitter.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://twitter.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @felixonmars > Enabling AdGuard Adblocker completely breaks Twitter's login here. It either shows a blank popup or "An error occurred" and doesn't complete login process. With other extensions unchanged and only AdGuard Adblocker disabled for the website, the login functionality works correctly. 100% reproducible after double-checking for some time. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/iJJueMJ.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/JJduEAl.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser extension v4.1.53 Browser: | Firefox Stealth mode: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

AdGuard Russian,

Liste AR,
EasyList Thailand,
Hungarian,

Official Polish filters for AdBlock, uBlock Origin & AdGuard,

Adblock List for Finland,

Dandelion Sprout's Nordic Filters
Other extensions used: | Dark Reader, Bitwarden, etc. No other ad blockers.

comment.body:
> @@||api.twitter.com/1.1/jot/client_event.json$domain=twitter.com

I have tried to unblock this among some others in the "Filtering log" window. Still no luck so far, and since it's easy to trigger a rate limit when the problem is present, I'll need some additional time to investigate.
